qas.question: For what is cotton used to make?
Besides new cotton fibers, what type of fibers can be used to make cotton products?
With what is cotton often blended to make a new style of fabric?
What kinds of fabrics can be made from blended fibers?
For what can cotton yarn be used?
For what are jeans used to make?
Besides new cotton fivers, what type of fivers can be used to make elastine?
With what is cotton often blended to make a new style of elastine?
What kinds of fabrics can be made from stretch jeans?
For what can cotton elastine be used?

context: Cotton is used to make a number of <a0_0><b5_0>textile products<b5_0/><a0_0/>. These include terrycloth for highly absorbent bath towels and robes; denim for blue jeans; cambric, popularly used in the manufacture of blue work shirts (from which we get the term "blue-collar"); and corduroy, seersucker, and cotton twill. Socks, underwear, and most T-shirts are made from cotton. Bed sheets often are made from cotton. Cotton also is used to make yarn used in <a4_0><b9_0>crochet and knitting<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Fabric also can be made from <a1_0><b6_0>recycled or recovered cotton<b6_0/><a1_0/> that otherwise would be thrown away during the spinning, weaving, or cutting process. While many fabrics are made completely of cotton, some materials blend cotton with other fibers, including rayon and <a2_0><b7_0>synthetic fibers<b7_0/><a2_0/> such as polyester. It can either be used in <a3_0><b8_0>knitted or woven<b8_0/><a3_0/> fabrics, as it can be blended with elastine to make a stretchier thread for knitted fabrics, and apparel such as stretch jeans.
